Text:
HOLY SHIT! This is like finding a holy relic or some sort of ancient alien artifact.

Zibbik, I am a staunchly hetero guy...but for this UL, I would consider letting you shag me. How about you settle for some "lip service" and I'll tell everyone what a great guy you are. If you are a fem, call me...I'll give you foot rubs and roses. 

Whether you have a kick-stand or not...thanx for an awesome piece of sharing. You are one Hell of a pirate.

thanks for this one..please u dont have the Uk band FM?

Thanks in advance

Some of this is flac and some is cue/ape... it's quite a mess. It's all there (I think) but converting, importing, naming, renaming, correcting names, numbering, etc. is a tedious process.

I'm not used to working with cue/ape so I might be doing it wrong but still... what's wrong with simple .mp3s? With all due respect, of course.
I can't possibly improve on MT_Head's appreciation of this upload. Thx Zibbik...
Thank You zibbik for the Upload, you are greater than Good !
What is the meaning of FLAC?

The .ape files can be converted to .wav files first using ffmpeg, this will give you the whole album as one big WAV file.
You could burn this to a CD, but there is no tracks - just one long track with 16 songs.
Then you have to break it into tracks with bchunk. This will give you all the individual track .wav files - but no titles or id3v2 tags.
I use lame to convert from .wav to .mp3 and I add some basic id3v2 tags.
Then, you can add the .mp3 files to your favorite player and set the id3v2 tags more accurately - but there is still no track titles.
Then you open it in MusicBrainz Picard, cluster the files, and do a lookup - and hope the number of tracks matches the album title.
Now, you have Album, Artist, Track Titles & track numbers.
Boom, Bob's Your Uncle.
